Plot: A boy is left alone in a Jewish neighborhood in the year of 1970, where both world cup and dictatorship happen in Brazil.
Title: The Year My Parents Went on Vacation
Writer: Adriana Falcão (script collaborator), Claudio Galperin, Cao Hamburger, Bráulio Mantovani, Anna Muylaert
Actors: Michel Joelsas, Germano Haiut, Paulo Autran, Simone Spoladore
tomatoConsensus: Hamburger deftly refracts the sociopolitical tumult of early '70s Brazil through the lens of a young boy's coming of age, and Joelsas' performance is wise beyond his years.
